StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_DeleteCandidatePriorService]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@MarineCandidateID int, @ComponentCode varchar(2), @EndDate date.me, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @ErrMsg varchar(100) DECLARE @SSN char(9) DECLARE @DBID int DECLARE @DBNAME sysname
SELECT @DBID = DB_ID(), @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM CANDIDATE_PRIOR_SERVICE WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID AND COMPONENT_CODE = @ComponentCode AND END_DATE = @EndDate) BEGIN
--- UPDATE THE USER LOGIN BEFORE DELETING SO THE TLOG WILL RECORD THE USER THAT DELETED THE RECORD UPDATE CANDIDATE_PRIOR_SERVICE SET USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateId AND COMPONENT_CODE = @ComponentCode AND END_DATE = @EndDate
--- DELETE THE RECORD DELETE FROM CANDIDATE_PRIOR_SERVICE WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID AND COMPONENT_CODE = @ComponentCode AND END_DATE = @EndDate
IF @@ERROR != 0 OR @@ROWCOUNT = 0 BEGIN SELECT @SSN = SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER FROM PERSON WHERE PERSON_ID = @MarineCandidateID
SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the Prior Service record for SSN ' + @SSN + '.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 1, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END END
SET NOCOUNT OFF
